channel.title: SMF packages problem
channel.description:
Honestly, I have no idea if some of you will be able to assist me or not, but it is worth a try posting since the SMF support hasn't replied to my thread again, and I personally don't know what is wrong.
The problem is that ever since I upgraded a forum from SMF 1.1.11 to SMF 2.0 RC2, the packages have not seemed to be working at all. At first the CHMOD function wasn't working on the package directory and a few files in it, if you find it relevant. But I had contacted my host support and they quickly fixed it, however it did not fix my Package problem. No matter what theme I use, none of my packages show up on either the forum or the Admin CP, nor do any part of what should be appearing from it.
Note that these packages also installed perfectly fine.
Any ideas?

item.title: SMF packages problem
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

mm I will try and figure this out anyway, I had a discussion with their support staff and it may be a fault of my hosting account, so we’ll have to see.

Anyway, thank you all for the help, it was well appreciated, and I’ll update this thread if the current plan doesn’t succeed. ;\

Read full topic

item.title: SMF packages problem
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Personally I have a setting on my server so that I have to restart the web server (lighttpd) when I change PHP files for the changes to show. I doubt you do though if you are using shared hosting.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF packages problem
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:11, topic:327138”][quote author=Jamie1200 link=topic=423534.msg3112090#msg3112090 date=1264628746]

Sometime the permissons need to be 755.
Have you tried to reinstall them? Have you downloaded the right Version?

I’ve tried on one file with the 755 idea, and it didn’t work to my knowledge, and also yes, I have tried reinstalling it. It is definatly the correct version also, with little doubt.

i honestly have no idea what is going wrong…There could be one thing, have you tried posting this on the SMF website? it could be a bug
[/quote]

I posted this a number of days ago, and one of their support staff just pointed out an issue that could be preventing the packages from working. They seem to have “mod_security2” installed onto my domain, so I have to talk to them about disabling it.[/quote]

Phpmyadmin?

Read full topic

item.title: SMF packages problem
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:6, topic:327138”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=423534.msg3112012#msg3112012 date=1264625902]

So the packages install correctly, or seem to, but just don’t show up? Are you using the default theme? And did you also install them to your other themes if any?

They seem to install fine, but none of their viewable features, i.e the settings in the Admin CP are appearing at all, and yes I have also tried multiple themes, and yes, they should also be installed on all themes, I hope…

If it is of any relevance to you: While installing is fine, if I try to un-install a package it gives me “test failed” on all the files, on most if not all of the packages.

[/quote]

I found this, did you change any permissons?[/quote]

I haven’t changed any permissions apart from the Package directory and some of the files and folders within, to 0777. I also had to get my host to fix the permissions on those files as they weren’t working properly.

Read full topic

item.title: SMF packages problem
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Pouch:

MoparIsTheBest thread on SMF support someone posted to turn off javascript or something then install, just look at last page, mabey what he did will work for you.

Ah that was a problem related with him upgrading to SMF, I have upgraded successfully although I did have previous problems when I had tried upgrading. This is a problem with my packages, they do not appear whatsoever even when they are installed.

Read full topic
